Fall 2021, Block 4 — MA240

Resources

The literature on data visualization, and the many disciplines that inform it, is vast. Here are some works that seem particularly useful to me.

Generalities

[Ber73]
Jacques Bertin. Semiology of Graphics: Diagrams, Networks, Maps (2010). Translated from the 2nd French edition (1973) by William J. Berg.
[Cle85]
William Cleveland. Elements of Graphing Data (1985).
[Cle93]
William Cleveland. Visualizing Data (1993).
[Kna15]
Cole Nussbaume Knaflic. Storytelling with Data (2015).
[Tuf90]
Edward Tufte. Envisioning Information (1990).
[Tuf01]
Edward Tufte. The Visual Display of Quantitative Information (2001). 2nd edition.
[Wil05]
Leland Wilkinson. The Grammar of Graphics (2005). 2nd edition. [CC URL].

Ethics

[ASA18]
American Statistical Association. Ethical Guidelines for Statistical Practice (2018). [URL].
[ISI10]
International Statistical Institute. Declaration on Professional Ethics (2010). [URL].
[VM03]
Stephen Vardeman and Max Morris. “Statistics and Ethics: Some Advice for Young Statisticians” (2003). The American Statistician. doi:10.1198/0003130031072. [CC URL].

Perception

[CM84]
William Cleveland and Robert McGill. “Graphical Perception: Theory, Experimentation, and Application to the Development of Graphical Models” (1984). Journal of the American Statistical Association. doi:10.2307/2288400. [CC URL].
[CM85]
William Cleveland and Robert McGill. “Graphical Perception and Graphical Methods for Analyzing Scientific Data” (1985). Science. doi:10.1126/science.229.4716.828. [CC URL].
[Mac]
Bruce MacEvoy. Handprint: Color Vision. [URL].
[War12]
Colin Ware. Information Visualization: Perception for Design (2012). 3rd edition. [CC URL].

Probability and Statistics

[Was04]
Larry Wasserman. All of Statistics: A Concise Course in Statistical Inference (2004).
[Was06]
Larry Wasserman. All of Nonparametric Statistics (2006). [CC URL].

R + RStudio + tidyverse + ggplot2

[Hol]
Yan Holtz. R Graph Gallery. [URL].
[WNP21]
Hadley Wickham, Danielle Navarro, and Thomas Lin Pedersen. ggplot2: Elegant Graphics for Data Analysis (2021). 3rd edition. [URL].
[WG17]
Hadley Wickham and Garrett Grolemund. R for Data Science: Import, Tidy, Transform, Visualize, and Model Data (2017). [URL].

Javascript + D3

[Mur17]
Scott Murray. Interactive Data Visualization for the Web: An Introduction to Designing with D3 (2017). 2nd edition.
